reg.acttitle: Pharmacists, Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act
reg.title: Access to Pharmanet Patient Record Information Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 330/2006, December 4, 2006]

definition.def: means access to patient record information on the PharmaNet system for the purpose of providing therapeutic treatment or care to patients;

paragraph.paragraphtext: a hospital, as defined in section 1 of the Hospital Act, other than a hospital or that part of a hospital that is a designated facility referred to in paragraph (c);
a designated facility, as defined in the Mental Health Act;

definition.def: means any premises in British Columbia where a medical practitioner ordinarily practises medicine.

section.sectiontext: Subject to section 3, the following persons are permitted to have access:

paragraph.paragraphtext: a person authorized to practise in British Columbia as a
a person authorized by a medical practitioner to have access

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: under the direct supervision of the medical practitioner, and
in the course of carrying out the person's employment or other duties in a designated location.

section.marginalnote: Requirements, restrictions and conditions for access
section.sectiontext: A person designated under section 2 is permitted to have access only

paragraph.paragraphtext: if the purpose and manner of access is consistent with the standards set out in the Ministry of Health Services' publication "PharmaNet Professional and Software Compliance Standards", as amended from time to time, and

content.regnote: Note: this regulation replaces B.C. Reg. 384/99.
content.provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Pharmacists, Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 363, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 38.1]
